title: The Papers: 'Nottingham rampage' and 'Mortgage misery looming'
description: Wednesday's front pages are dominated by reports of the fatal attacks which unfolded in Nottingham.

title: Italy mourns and asks who will succeed Berlusconi
description: Italians say goodbye to the four-time PM and ask who will lead his party and run his businesses.

title: England's overlooked 2005 Ashes win: 'Everyone thought we were the Wags'
description: In 2005 a first series win over Australia in more than a generation propelled England's men to superstardom. England's women, having ended an even longer wait, were anonymous in their wake.

title: Afghan migrants kidnapped and tortured on Iran-Turkey border
description: Gangs send videos of the abuse to hostages’ families demanding ransoms, a BBC investigation reveals.

title: Nottingham: Three attack victims stabbed to death, police confirm
description: Two 19-year-old university students and a man in his 50s were killed in the city on Tuesday morning.

title: Nadine Dorries keeps party waiting on by-election
description: The former cabinet minister is yet to officially resign as an MP, putting a vote to replace her on hold.

title: 'More important things than tennis' - Murray on Nottingham attacks
description: Andy Murray says there are "more important things than tennis" after three people were killed and another three injured in a series of attacks in Nottingham.

title: US author Cormac McCarthy dies aged 89
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning author of The Road has died aged 89, his publisher says.

title: US Open: Jon Rahm says players feel betrayed over PGA Tour-PIF merger plans
description: World number two Jon Rahm says players are still in the dark about what the proposed PGA Tour merger with Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund will mean for them.

title: Trump supporters outside court: 'It doesn't matter'
description: Trumps supporters share their opinions on the former president's arraignment outside the courthouse.

title: Boris Johnson sends last-ditch letter to Partygate inquiry
description: The inquiry says it is "dealing with" submissions from the former PM, as it prepares its findings.

title: Nottingham Open: Andy Murray beats Joris de Loore to progress to the second round
description: Watch the best shots as Great Britain's Andy Murray beats Belgium's Joris de Loore 6-3 6-4 in the opening round of the Nottingham Open.

title: Yes, it's been officially hot! Heatwave declared in parts of UK
description: A heat-health alert has been extended until next week as 30.7C was recorded in Wales on Tuesday.

title: Aslan singer Christy Dignan dies after long illness
description: The Dublin-born singer of Irish rock band Aslan has died at the age of 63, his family said.

title: Thirsk man hit by falling tree branch says dog saved his life
description: Malcolm Myers says rescue dog Buddy started digging to free him after he got trapped under a branch.

title: Many more women now beating early breast cancer
description: The risk of dying from the disease has fallen in past 20 years thanks to new treatments, a study says.

title: 'Dream come true' for Sam Fender's guitar tutor
description: Phil Martin performed with Fender and AC/DC's Brian Johnson at a sold out St James' Park.

title: Massive lockdown impact was not considered, inquiry hears
description: The lead lawyer questions the approach taken, saying the impact of lockdowns had not been fully considered.

title: The Ashes 2023: Moeen Ali reveals the message Ben Stokes sent to get him to return to England
description: Moeen Ali talks through his thought process on his return to the England squad and what Ben Stokes said on a message to him.

title: The Ashes 2023: England's entertainers take on ominous Australia - Felix White column
description: In his first BBC Sport column this summer, Felix White says the men's Ashes is set to be an outstanding contest after an unusual build-up.

title: Paul Rendall: Former England and Wasps prop dies aged 69
description: Paul Rendall dies at the age of 69 after being diagnosed with motor neurone disease last year.

title: Ukraine offensive: BBC visits village liberated from Russian control
description: Neskuchne in Donetsk region saw the heaviest fighting according to the battalion which liberated it.

title: Ely riots: Police officers' conduct before fatal crash probed
description: The conduct of two officers in a police van before the fatal crash will be examined by the watchdog.

title: Wind farm which will help produce Irn-Bru opens
description: The turbines at South Kyle will provide electricity to sites where the soft drink is made.

title: Sgt Matiu Ratana: Met officer murder accused sad he died, jury hears
description: Louis De Zoysa is accused of murdering Sgt Matiu Ratana by shooting him at a custody centre.

title: Alfie Steele: The sports-mad boy killed by brutal punishments
description: Nine-year-old Alfie Steele died at the hands of his mother and her partner after years of abuse.

title: Junior doctors to strike in Scotland after rejecting pay offer
description: BMA Scotland said its members would take three days of strike action between 12 and 15 July.

title: The Ashes 2023: Moeen Ali says Ben Stokes is the only captain he would have returned for
description: Moeen Ali says he would not have come out of retirement to play in the Ashes for any other England captain than Ben Stokes.

title: Prince William sees homelessness help for young workers
description: A homelessness charity provides housing for young people with jobs but struggling with costs of rent.

title: Alfie Steele: Mum and partner guilty of killing boy in bath
description: Alfie Steele, 9, was repeatedly dunked head first into a cold bath as part of a discipline regime.

title: Southwark: Rare Roman mausoleum unearthed in London
description: Excavators say the discovery is incredibly rare and "completely unique".

title: Porthcawl: Aircraft crashes into sea off south Wales coast
description: Coastguard says the pilot made his way to dry land after the aircraft came down into the sea.

title: Nottingham attacks: What we know so far
description: Three people are dead and three more injured following a series of attacks in Nottingham city centre.

title: Queens of the Stone Age frontman reveals he had cancer surgery
description: The Queens of the Stone Age frontman says he is "extremely thankful that I'll get through this".

title: French man on trial for killing three women in job grievances
description: The suspect is accused of targeting French HR managers he held responsible for wrecking his career.

title: 'Heavyweight boxing is a relentlessly boring pantomime'
description: In his BBC Sport column, Steve Bunce says the past six months of heavyweight boxing has been a "pantomime" which is "seemingly endless and relentlessly boring".

title: NI police apologise to 'Hooded Men' over interrogations
description: The 14 men were arrested during internment without trial and questioned by the police and army.

title: Sainsbury's and Asda told not to block rival stores
description: The supermarkets are accused of stopping rivals opening nearby, potentially reducing consumer choice.

title: Mortgages: New squeeze on landlords will hit renters too
description: High mortgage costs mean landlords face a "turning point", a firm warns, leading to fewer homes to rent.

title: Landslides and flooding disrupt road and rail travel in the Highlands
description: A woman had to be rescued after a 100-tonne landslide hit a Highland road, leading to a 113-mile diversion.

title: Kylian Mbappe: Where will PSG superstar play next season?
description: Kylian Mbappe will not be short of admirers if Paris St-Germain decide to sell the France forward this summer - but where could the 24-year-old realistically end up?

title: Nadine Dorries says sinister forces stopped her peerage
description: The former cabinet minister accuses Rishi Sunak's team of blocking her seat in the Lords, as rift within Tory party continues.

title: Colombia plane crash: New video shows lost children found in Amazon
description: Footage shows rescuers tending to the children after they survived 40 days in the Amazon.

title: Britain's Got Talent star Jack Carroll on new BBC Three show Mobility
description: Comedian Jack Carroll tells Newsbeat about why he hopes his BBC Three short will make a difference.

title: Marathon Eryri to drop Snowdonia from official name
description: Marathon Eryri says it is important to focus on "authenticity" as it drops Snowdonia from its title.

title: Ofsted and Ruth Perry: MPs launch inquiry into school inspections
description: A committee will look at how useful inspections are for parents, governors and schools in England.

title: NBA: Denver Nuggets beat Miami heat 4-1 to clinch first title
description: The Denver Nuggets win their first NBA title by beating Miami Heat to seal a 4-1 series triumph and end a 47-year wait for the championship trophy.

title: Lionel Messi: Can Argentine's move to Inter Miami revolutionise football in US?
description: Will Lionel Messi's move to Inter Miami change football in the United States forever? We take a look at the impact it could have.

title: Sir Paul McCartney says artificial intelligence has enabled a 'final' Beatles song
description: The star says machine learning helped lift John Lennon's voice from a demo and turn it into a song.

title: Road closures in Nottingham as police deal with 'serious incident'
description: People are being told to avoid the area and plan alternate routes around the city centre.

title: BBC Sport's top 40 most engaging football stories from the 2022-23 season
description: These are the most engaging football stories that you have been reading this season. Grab a brew, sit down and enjoy.

title: US sprinter Bowie died from complications in childbirth, agent says
description: American sprinter Tori Bowie, who died in May at the age of 32, died from complications in childbirth, her agent says.

title: Treat Williams: Everwood and Hair actor dies in road accident
description: The star of Hair and Everwood had over 130 acting credits in career that spanned almost 50 years.

title: Number not working due to sickness hits fresh record
description: Around 2.6 million people are not working due to long-term health problems, official figures show.

title: NBA: Denver Nuggets beat Miami Heat to claim first NBA title
description: The Denver Nuggets clinch their first NBA title as Nikola Jokic scores 28 points in a 94-89 win over the Miami Heat on Monday seals a 4-1 series win.

title: Watch: Trapper wrestles massive alligator from US pool
description: Wildlife specialists got the call from a Florida resident and were able to release the 10ft (3m) reptile.

title: How Silvio Berlusconi paved the way for populist politics
description: The three-time prime minister leaves an indelible stamp on his country and on the European continent as a whole.

title: Glenn McGrath predicts 5-0 Australia win in Ashes - what do other TMS pundits think?
description: What do the Test Match Special team predict for the most eagerly anticipated Ashes series in a generation?

title: The Ashes: Ben Stokes on his captaincy, team culture and the challenge of Australia
description: Ben Stokes speaks to BBC Test Match Special's Isa Guha about his approach to captaincy, how to build a positive culture and Australia's threat.

title: Ashes 2023: England's James Anderson and Emma Lamb answer kids' questions
description: England cricketers James Anderson and Emma Lamb answer questions from schoolchildren.

title: Broken-down Hampshire bus brides praise officers who rescued them
description: Jemma and Sian Batchelor-Thomas were rescued by police when their coach broke down in Hedge End.

title: Ukraine conflict: Are Russians optimistic about the war?
description: The BBC's Russia editor uses the national holiday "Russia day" to ask people their thoughts on the war.

title: Calls for abortion law reform after mother jailed
description: The Commons equalities committee chair says it is time to debate "outdated" abortion rules.

title: Hunter Valley crash: Bus driver going too fast, police say
description: The tragedy has rocked a small rural town in the Hunter Valley where many victims lived.

title: Women to get gay-conviction pardons for first time
description: Previous schemes in England and Wales only applied to some offences linked to gay men.

title: 'Dead' woman found breathing in coffin at own funeral
description: Mourners realised the woman was still alive several hours after she was placed inside a cofifn.
